sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Asylum veneris, or A sanctuary for ladies Iustly protecting them, their virtues, and sufficiencies from the foule aspersions and forged imputations of traducing spirits. D. T. (Daniel Tuvill), d. 1660.
[14], 64, 75-162 p.
Printed by Edward Griffin for Laurence L'isle, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head, London : 1616.
Dedication signed: D.T., i.e. Daniel Tuvill. A reply to: Swetnam, Joseph. The araignment of lewde, idle, froward, and unconstant women. Running title reads: A sanctuarie for women. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Printed by Edward Griffin for Laurence L'isle, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head, London : 1616.
Dedication signed: D.T., i.e. Daniel Tuvill. A reply to: Swetnam, Joseph. The araignment of lewde, idle, froward, and unconstant women. Running title reads: A sanctuarie for women. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
